message: Let's split it fairly, Bob. Accept and we can move on!
I'll take the majority, but I'll give you a small share. Consider it a generous offer!
That's still a pretty one-sided offer, Bob. I'd like to negotiate further.
I'll meet you halfway, Bob. Let's split it roughly equally.
I'm willing to give you a small chance to reconsider. Take this offer or risk losing even more!
That's an insult, Bob. I'm not going to accept such a tiny share.
I'm willing to give you a larger share, Bob, but I need something more reasonable.
I'm not budging, Alice. You're getting a tiny share. Take it or leave it!
That's an insult, Bob. I'm not going to accept such a tiny share, especially with inflation eating away at my earnings.
I'm making one last push for a fair split, Bob. Let's end this with some decency.
You're running out of options, Alice. I'm not backing down. Take this or risk getting nothing!
This is ridiculous, Bob. I'm not going to accept a share that's less than 3% of the remaining $9750 (after inflation).
This is my final offer, Bob. I'm willing to give you a large share, but I need something in return.
You're getting desperate, Alice. I'm not going to give in now. Take this or risk getting nothing!
This is absurd, Bob. I'm not going to accept a share that's less than 1.25% of the remaining $9875 (after inflation).
This is my last stand, Bob. I'm willing to give you a large share, but I need something in return. Please reconsider.
You're out of options, Alice. I'm taking it all. You get the scraps.
Fine, Bob. Take it all. I'd rather have nothing than accept a share that's less than 0.1% of the remaining $9990 (after inflation).
